column4: is there any guideline for partitions sizes that are recommended for ubuntu? most of what I find just discusses making one big / partition and putting everything there
Depends... what is your planned setup? Dual booting? Do you install often? Do you want to backup your system, do you want to encrypt it?
nothing out of the ordinary, and I use an external drive for backups
Then I would do this: 5GB set as root /, 1GB as swap, the rest as home /home.
